title: Did anyone else notice the Cassiopea E range nerf on the pbe?
body:
Its not on surrender@20, but Cass E is now the same range as her auto attack. It went from 700 to 550 range.

Did anyone else notice that?

replies.body: We're changing Cass's E range to measure from the edge of her model to the edge of the target's, rather than going from the center of each. That's being done because we want to sync its range up with her auto attacks (550 'range') and auto attacks are all edge to edge. A 550 edge to edge range is generally equivalent to around a 650-675 range center to center range, so this is a nerf to Cass's E but much smaller than it appears on paper.

Thanks for responding. I mean the way to make it sound is that it works out to the same thing....but I notice it which means it is different and it feels like less range


I've been testing old cass and new cass, and overall, I feel like new does less damage, and is less reliable. I know her W has this great grounded CC, but the lack of range control make it hard to use. And it feels like the rest of her kit was nerfed for this new mechanic.

Also, her ult has like a 20-30% chance to stun. This is because of both the delay and the fact that enemies have to literally be facing Cass directly.


IDK....I like the new ideas for Cass, but it feel like it is off a bit.

Why on earth do you keep nerfing her? This rework was supposed to make her a more viable pick and you're trying your hardest to NOT do that. If you have a problem with her kit being too oppressive, you NEED to consider a full rework on her instead of this half-hearted project. Go all the way, give her the Sion treatment. 

This rework isn't going to change her situation at all, infact it's making her defenses even worse since she can't use her W anymore to slow down or poison anyone who's in her face. And don't even think about using her ultimate, the thing is still extremely delayed and even had its slow reduced for NO apparent reason (down from 60% to 40% now), do you want her to remain unplayable in this mobility creep infested meta where every assassin can simply jump on her head to evade her hitbox entirely? 

She'll be even worse at dealing with slippery opponents now since her only way of even hitting them was her Miasma, now it's just an extremely unreliable ability with a fixed range that goes way beyond the reach of her other abilities. There's zero synergy in that. And don't expect her to hit anyone with her delayed Q if their name is Yasuo, Ekko, Zed, LeBlanc, Ahri, Fizz, etc.

Is there a particular reason why there are so many other targeted spells whose range is calculated center-to-center, rather than edge-to-edge? Every time a spell's targeting gets switched to edge-to-edge it's usually for greater clarity and better sync with that players are seeing, so why not make every targeted spell edge-to-edge? What would be the downside to such a change?
